rule.description: If the person who committed the crime is under 14 years old, the tortious act cannot be attributed to them.
If the violated rule was not meant to protect the injured person, the tortious act cannot be attributed to them.
If the person cannot be held responsible, the tortious act cannot be attributed to them.

question.description: Can the person be held responsible for the tortious act?

option.description: Yes, the act was due to their fault or they are accountable by law/common rules
No, the act was justified or not their fault

question.description: Was the person who commited the crime under 14 years old?

option.description: The person was under 14 years old
The person was over 14 years old

question.description: Was the person who committed the crime under the influence of a mental or physical disability?

option.description: The person was under the influence of a mental or physical disability
The person was not under the influence of a mental or physical disability

question.description: Was the violated rule meant to protect the injured person?
